document.docAuthor: Khalaim, Andrey I. & Broad, Gavin R.
document.docTitle: Stethantyx heredia Khalaim et Broad, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Tersilochinae (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae) of Costa Rica, part 2. Genera Megalochus gen. nov. and Stethantyx Townes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Tersilochinae (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae) of Costa Rica, part 2. Genera Megalochus gen. nov. and Stethantyx Townes

heading.emphasis:
Stethantyx heredia Khalaim et Broad
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comparison. Differs from other species of
Stethantyx
by the combination of the black flagellum, orange mesosoma, black head with yellowish face (
Fig. 12
), and propodeum with basal keel and anteriorly pointed apical area (
Fig. 36
).
Description. Female . Body length about 8.2 mm . Fore wing length 4.9 mm .

Head strongly rounded behind eyes in dorsal view; temple 0.41 × as long as eye width. Mandible with upper tooth much longer than lower tooth. Clypeus broad, lenticular, flat or very weakly convex in lateral view, smooth, with sparse punctures on its upper half. Malar space about 0.35 × as long as basal width of mandible. Flagellum of antenna with 29–35 flagellomeres ( 34 flagellomeres in holotype ); basal and mid flagellomeres usually slightly elongate, subapical flagellomeres subsquare to slightly transverse. Inner eye orbits subparallel. Face with central prominence. Face, frons and vertex very finely granulate, densely and finely punctate. Temple with moderate dense fine punctures, smooth and shining between punctures.

First tergite 3.83 × as long as posteriorly broad, entirely smooth. Glymma situated slightly behind middle of tergite 1 , moderate sized, isolated or with very shallow furrow joining ventral part of postpetiole. Second tergite almost 1.9 × as long as anteriorly broad. Thyridial depression more than 4.0× as long as broad. Ovipositor weakly upcurved, with shallow dorsal subapical depression; sheath about 1.7 × as long as first tergite and about 1.55 × as long as hind tibia.

Male . Malar space shorter. Flagellum usually with 33–37 flagellomeres, all flagellomeres usually elongate. Foveate groove of mesopleuron weaker, anteriorly without distinct wrinkles reaching anterior margin of mesopleuron. Mesosoma lighter than in female, predominantly yellowish to yellowish orange, dorsally brownish orange, sometimes propodeum reddish brown, conspicuously darker than rest mesosoma. Metasoma behind tergite 1 dorsally more or less entirely dark brown to black, or sometimes metasoma almost entirely dark brown.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 36–39.
Stethantyx heredia
sp. nov.
, Ƥ: 36—propodeum, dorsal.
Stethantyx niger
sp. nov.
, Ƥ: 37—mesosoma, left; 38—propodeum, dorsal.
Stethantyx notaulator
sp. nov.
, Ƥ: 39—upper part of mesosoma, left. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. This species is rather variable in the structure of the propodeum and colour pattern. Some specimens have the propodeum with the basal keel indistinct, substituted by two or more longitudinal wrinkles and/ or a shallow groove; apical area in such specimens is sometimes broadly rounded anteriorly. One female from Sector Cerro Cocori in Limón Prov. has tergite 2 short, only 1.6 × as long as anteriorly broad. Some dark males have the face only slightly paler than the remaining black head. Some small males have the propodeum reddish brown, conspicuously darker than the remaining yellowish to reddish-orange mesosoma.
Etymology. Named after the type locality, Heredia province of Costa Rica .

Material examined. Holotype
female (BMNH), Heredia Prov., Braulio Carrillo National Park, 9.5 km E of El Tunel, 1000 m ,
V–VI. 1990
, coll. I.D. Gauld.
